info.author: Christopher Brown
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
info.description:
PyAudiere is a very flexible and easy to use audio library.
        Available methods allow you to read soundfiles of various formats
        into memory and play them, or stream them if they are large. You
        can pass sound buffers as NumPy arrays of float32's to play
        (non-blocking). You can also create pure tones, square waves, or
        'on-line' white or pink noise. All of these functions can
        be utilized concurrently. Sweet!
info.name: pyaudiere
info.summary: PyAudiere! A high-level audio interface for Python.
info.html_description:
PyAudiere is a very flexible and easy to use audio library.
Available methods allow you to read soundfiles of various formats into memory and play them, or stream them if they are large. You can pass sound buffers as NumPy arrays of float32’s to play (non-blocking). You can also create pure tones, square waves, or ‘on-line’ white or pink noise. All of these functions can be utilized concurrently. Sweet!
